thread.title: WSU safety Shalom Luani named Pac-12 defensive player of the week
thread.title_full: WSU safety Shalom Luani named Pac-12 defensive player of the week - seattlepi.com

author: ADAM LEWIS, SEATTLEPI.COM
title: WSU safety Shalom Luani named Pac-12 defensive player of the week
text:
Washington State safety Shalom Luani was named Pac-12 defensive player of the week Monday for his work in the Cougars' 52-31 win over Oregon State this past weekend at Martin Stadium.
The junior made a game-high, 11 tackles, eight solo, had a pass break-up and two interceptions of OSU quarterback Seth Collins, including a pick-six late in the fourth quarter that he returned 84 yards -- a conference-high -- for the score. The Beavers' next possession, Luani added his second interception to ice the Cougars' (4-2, 2-1) second consecutive win. 
A former soccer player in American Samoa , Luani is in his first season at WSU after transferring from City College of San Francisco. He originally verbally committed to Oregon State, then opted for WSU after coach Mike Riley bailed for Nebraska. As a result, the abysmal WSU secondary from a year ago has benefitted while Luani's big hits that might remind fans of 2014 WSU first-round pick Deone Bucannon. 
Luani has three interceptions on the season, tied for second in the conference, along with Washington defensive back Kevin King and Utah defensive back Dominique Hatfield. 
Prior to Luani, the Cougars hadn't had a defensive player earn Pac-12 player of the week since cornerback Damante Horton had two interceptions, including a pick-six, in a 2013 road win over USC.
Stanford running back Christian McCaffrey was named the conference's offensive player of the week and Arizona State punter Tim White earned special teams player of the week as well.
